gw.api.email

Class EmailUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.email.EmailUtil

  • public class EmailUtil
extends Object
    Utility class containing methods to create and send email messages. This class mostly just passes calls through to the underlying system dependencies which do the actual work.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmailUtil()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String emailContentsValid(Email email)
      This will validate an e-mail message. The string will be empty if no warnings.
      static void sendEmailWithBody(KeyableBean entity, Email email)
      Sends an e-mail message. Note that the supplied entity may be null; if it is not null, then the email message will be sent when the bundle containing the supplied entity is committed. If this is invoked in a transaction, the transaction bundle will be used and the email message will be sent when the transaction completes. Throws a UserDisplayableException if the email cannot be sent for some reason.
      static void sendEmailWithBody(KeyableBean entity, String toEmailAddress, String toName, String fromEmailAddress, String fromName, String subject, String body)
      Sends an e-mail message. Note that the supplied entity may be null; if it is not null, then the email message will be sent when the bundle containing the supplied entity is committed. If this is invoked in a transaction, the transaction bundle will be used and the email message will be sent when the transaction completes.
      static void sendEmailWithBody(KeyableBean entity, Contact to, Contact from, String subject, String body)
      Sends an e-mail message. Note that the supplied entity may be null; if it is not null, then the email message will be sent when the bundle containing the supplied entity is committed. If this is invoked in a transaction, the transaction bundle will be used and the email message will be sent when the transaction completes.

    • Method Detail

      • emailContentsValid

        String emailContentsValid(Email email)
        This will validate an e-mail message. The string will be empty if no warnings.
        Parameters:
        email - the email to check
        Returns:
        the warning messages

      • sendEmailWithBody

        void sendEmailWithBody(KeyableBean entity,
                     Email email)
        Sends an e-mail message. Note that the supplied entity may be null; if it is not null, then the email message will be sent when the bundle containing the supplied entity is committed. If this is invoked in a transaction, the transaction bundle will be used and the email message will be sent when the transaction completes. Throws a UserDisplayableException if the email cannot be sent for some reason.
        Parameters:
        entity - may be null. If not null, a KeyableBean whose bundle should be used in the generation of this message
        email - the email to be sent

      • sendEmailWithBody

        void sendEmailWithBody(KeyableBean entity,
                     String toEmailAddress,
                     String toName,
                     String fromEmailAddress,
                     String fromName,
                     String subject,
                     String body)
        Sends an e-mail message. Note that the supplied entity may be null; if it is not null, then the email message will be sent when the bundle containing the supplied entity is committed. If this is invoked in a transaction, the transaction bundle will be used and the email message will be sent when the transaction completes.
        Parameters:
        entity - may be null. If not null, a KeyableBean whose bundle should be used in the generation of this message
        toEmailAddress - the e-mail address of the recipient
        toName - the name of the recipient
        fromEmailAddress - the e-mail address of the sender
        fromName - the name of the sender
        subject - the subject of the e-mail message.
        body - the body of the e-mail message.

      • sendEmailWithBody

        void sendEmailWithBody(KeyableBean entity,
                     Contact to,
                     Contact from,
                     String subject,
                     String body)
        Sends an e-mail message. Note that the supplied entity may be null; if it is not null, then the email message will be sent when the bundle containing the supplied entity is committed. If this is invoked in a transaction, the transaction bundle will be used and the email message will be sent when the transaction completes.
        Parameters:
        entity - may be null. If not null, a KeyableBean whose bundle should be used in the generation of this message
        to - the Contact to whom the e-mail should be sent.
        from - the Contact from whom the e-mail should be sent.
        subject - the subject of the e-mail message.
        body - the body of the e-mail message.
